docs.title: Welcome to MicroBIM Fire Documentation
docs.text:
At MicroBIM Fire, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive and well-structured documentation for our libraries, tailored to meet the needs of developers in the AEC industry.

Our documentation covers:

  • Revit Extensions: A library offering robust tools and APIs to extend Revit's functionality, enabling seamless automation and enhanced workflows.
  • WPF UI Library: A collection of intuitive user interface components designed specifically for WPF-based Revit applications.
  • Revit Geometry Manipulation: Tools for handling and processing Revit's geometric data with precision and efficiency.
  • Revit Data Handling: Clear guidance for accessing, managing, and processing Revit's data models.

With practical examples, real-world use cases, and detailed explanations, our documentation ensures that developers can effectively integrate our tools into their workflows. By empowering developers to innovate, we aim to drive productivity and foster advancements in the AEC industry.

Explore the following sections to get started: - Classes - About

Let’s build the future together!

docs.title: About MicroBIM
docs.text:
MicroBIM is dedicated to revolutionizing apps for the construction industry...

docs.title: ResourceManager
docs.text:
Summary

Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

docs.title: Culture
docs.text:
Summary

Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

docs.title: About
docs.text:
Summary

Looks up a localized string similar to About.

docs.title: #ctor
docs.text:
Summary

Initializes a new instance of the class.

docs.title: SwitchTheme
docs.text:
Summary

Switches the application theme between dark and light modes.

docs.title: Parameters:
docs.text: Name Description btn The toggle button that triggers the theme switch.

docs.title: Parameters:
docs.text: Name Description key The key of the string to retrieve.

docs.title: Returns:
docs.text: The localized string or a placeholder if not found.

docs.title: SetLang
docs.text:
Summary

Binds a dependency property to a language resource key.

docs.title: UpdateLangs
docs.text:
Summary

Updates localized values for all keys in the resource file.

docs.title: RevalidateControls
docs.text:
Summary

Revalidates all controls bound to the validation rules.

docs.title: FindVisualChildren``1
docs.text:
Summary

Finds all visual children of a given type in a visual tree.

docs.title: Parameters:
docs.text: Name Description dependencyObject The root visual element.

docs.title: OpenLink
docs.text:
Summary

Opens a link in the default web browser or associated application.

docs.title: Parameters:
docs.text: Name Description url The URL or file path to open. This parameter should be a valid object that can be converted to a string.

Summary

Summary

Initializes a new instance of the class.

docs.title: ApplyCustomBrush
docs.text:
Summary

Applies the custom brush to the window resources.

docs.title: Parameters:
docs.text: Name Description color The color to apply.

docs.title: Parameters:
docs.text: Name Description d The dependency object. e The event arguments.

docs.title: OpenLink
docs.text:
Summary

Opens a link in the default web browser or associated application.

docs.title: Parameters:
docs.text: Name Description url The URL or file path to open. This should be a valid string representation of the resource.

docs.title: Exceptions:
docs.text:
• T:System.ArgumentNullException: Thrown when the is null.

  • T:System.InvalidOperationException: Thrown when the is not a valid string.

docs.title: ToObservableCollection``1
docs.text:
Summary

Converts an enumerable collection to an ObservableCollection.

docs.title: Parameters:
docs.text: Name Description source The source enumerable collection to convert.

docs.title: Returns:
docs.text: An ObservableCollection containing the elements from the source.

docs.title: GetFamilyTypesByCategoryOrderedByName
docs.text:
Summary

Retrieves all family types of the specified category from the given Revit document as an ObservableCollection.

docs.title: Parameters:
docs.text: Name Description doc The Revit document to search for family types. category The BuiltInCategory to filter family types.

docs.title: Returns:
docs.text: An ObservableCollection containing all FamilySymbol objects representing the specified category.

docs.title: GetLevelsOrderedByProperty``1
docs.text:
Summary

Retrieves all levels from the specified Revit document as an ObservableCollection, with dynamic ordering based on a specified property.

docs.title: Parameters:
docs.text: Name Description doc The Revit document to search for levels. keySelector A function to extract a key from a Level for ordering. ascending If true, orders levels in ascending order; otherwise, descending.

docs.title: Returns:
docs.text: An ObservableCollection containing Level objects, ordered dynamically by the specified property.

docs.title: GetRebarShapes
docs.text:
Summary

Retrieves all rebar shapes from the specified Revit document.

docs.title: Parameters:
docs.text: Name Description doc The Revit document to retrieve rebar shapes from.

docs.title: Returns:
docs.text: A list of RebarShape objects available in the document.

docs.title: GetRebarBarTypes
docs.text:
Summary

Retrieves all rebar bar types from the specified Revit document as an ObservableCollection.

docs.title: Parameters:
docs.text: Name Description doc The Revit document to retrieve rebar bar types from.

docs.title: Returns:
docs.text: An ObservableCollection containing all RebarBarType objects in the document.

docs.title: CreateAndPlaceColumnAtPoint
docs.text:
Summary

Prompts the user to select a point and places a column at that point.

docs.title: Parameters:
docs.text: Name Description doc The Revit document where the column will be placed. point The XYZ point where the column will be placed. columnType The FamilySymbol representing the column type. baseLevel The base level of the column. topLevel The top level of the column.

docs.title: Returns:
docs.text: The created column Element, or null if no column was created.

docs.title: SearchOrCreate3DView
docs.text:
Summary

Searches for a 3D view with the specified name. If it exists, returns it. Otherwise, creates a new 3D view.

docs.title: Parameters:
docs.text: Name Description doc The Revit document to search or create the 3D view in. viewName The name of the 3D view to search for or create.

docs.title: Returns:
docs.text: The existing or newly created View3D object.
